english: the shape of a basket repeatedly woven from bamboo

etymology.description: two 魚(魚) (yú, "fish") with mouths facing each other -> original form -> corrupted to "crossly accumulated woods"
etymology.interpretation: The character 冓(gòu) originally depicted two fish meeting, emphasizing the idea of convergence or encounter, which relates to its use in 遘(遘). Over time, the form was misinterpreted and evolved into the erroneous understanding of 'crossly accumulated woods'.
